intro: Leptosyne parthenioides, commonly known as the silver dollar plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its compact, evergreen growth habit with small, silver-gray leaves. The plant produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and low maintenance requirements. Leptosyne parthenioides thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
